text: Hi Felicia, Another think I happily take some advice on is any handy tips you've found useful in steamlining your pipeline so your not grinding your pc to a haly.

I have bought a very powerful PC but I still find im slowing it down to am only using a pretty basic keying pipeline, its not like I'm doing deep compositing on it. Just curious what you find helps make playback more efficient when compositing in general/

Okay yeah sure! Unfortunately it's super common and kinda hard to figure out. But here's some basic tips that helps a lot. 
Always keep an eye on your bounding box, it can slow you down a lot and ruin your renders. When I got the time to be tidy I usually set the merge node "set bbox to" B. Or just keep on top with your crops. 
Nuke really doesn't like certain formats, try to avoid tifs and ps files for example. 
Utilize the downsrez and area selection in your viewer. You dont always need to process the full image. 
Precomp heavy nodes 
MotionBlur can be super heavy, turn it off when you're working 
That's just some very general basic tips, I hope its somewhat useful!
